channel.title: Bioinformatics Blogs
channel.description: A feed of the latest posts of Bioinformatics blogs around the world

item.title: Weekly Recap (December 24, 2025)
item.description: R updates (R Data Scientist, R Weekly), AI accelerating wet lab bio research, Docker hardened images, LLMs in review, machinal bypass, science funding, new papers.

item.title: High-fat diets make liver cells more likely to become cancerous
item.description: Single-cell RNA sequencing reveals how a high-fat diet drives hepatocytes into an immature state, increasing susceptibility to liver cancer and identifying targets to prevent tumorigenesis...

item.title: Clair3-RNA ‚Äì a deep learning-based small variant caller for long-read RNA sequencing data
item.description: A new deep learning tool improves RNA sequencing variant detection from long reads, enabling accurate analysis of full-length isoforms and RNA editing across PacBio and Nanopore platforms...

item.title: ASPEN ‚Äì robust detection of allelic dynamics in single cell RNA-seq
item.description: New ASPEN method enhances detection of allelic imbalance and variance in RNA sequencing data, revealing subtle gene regulation patterns in single cells...

item.title: Spiritual Bypass, but with GPUs
item.description: The "Machinal Bypass," when AI becomes a shortcut around the work that makes us human, and why some tasks should feel a little hard.
